Issues.Title: HttpHeaders set/append not working.
Issues.Body:
Refer to 'https://angular.io/api/common/http/HttpHeaders', I try to set/append header for my post html.

My code is like:

header.set(...); // still no headers in header.

Issues.Title: Relative paths do not behave as expected per docs
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/router


### Is this a regression?
I'm not sure, I'm new to Angular


### Description
The relative path support in Angular does not behave as one might expect.  There are scenarios where you want to trigger a navigation because you're using matrix params, but you want to stay on the same route (in my case, persisting in the URL a view preference so it returns to that preference on refresh).  There are no clear docs on using matrix params in this way.  I don't want to pull in any awareness of the global route to my component to set an absolute path (which solves the problem).

Upon further investigation, we found that the issue is more with the using relative path.  I was concerned that it might be some of our own custom work with URL management in our codebase, so I set up a demo environment here: https://codesandbox.io/s/angular-sb9wz


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
In this codesandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/angular-sb9wz) you'll see that I've set up a few nested routes.  There are various links to try out that all demonstrate the various unexpected behaviors.

### Case 1:  I'm at a pretty deep URL, and I want to just set the matrix params.

1) Click on "Static - Go to /crisis-center/incidents/none". Your URL should now be

`/crisis-center/incidents/none`

2) Click on "JS - Params (relative)", which calls:

`this.router.navigate(["./", { viewType: "something" }]);`

3) Notice that your url is actually now

`/crisis-center;viewType=something`

### Case 2: I'm on a deep URL, and I want to just go up one level

1) Click on "Static - Go to /crisis-center/incidents/none". Your URL should now be

`/crisis-center/incidents/none`

2) Click on "JS - Go up (via "../")", which calls:

`this.router.navigate(["../"]);`

3) Notice that your url is actually now just the root of the page
4) Change your code to 

`this.router.navigate(["../"], { relativeTo: this.route });`

5) And notice that it also does not help.  I would expect my url to in this situation be

`/crisis-center/incidents`




## üî• Exception or Error

There's no code exception


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

9, and also tested on 8.2.9
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Relative paths do not behave as expected per docs" (#33044)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Use index.d.ts for typings
Issues.Body:
The current `typings` value in `package.json` causes the import of
`@angular/language-service` in TypeScript to be generated as

```
const language_service_1 = require("@angular/language-service/language-service");
```
in CJS output.

This breaks the import shim that overwrites the behavior of `require` at
runtime. Changing the typings to `index.d.ts` fixes the issue.

Issues.Title: Add documentation for PR authors on how to use fixup commits
Issues.Body:
PRs in this repository are merged using a script that supports `fixup` commits. Good usage of `fixup` commits in a PR makes reviewers lives easier by compartimentalizing sets of requested changes in individual commits that will be squashed into a single commit only when the PR is merged.

There should be documentation for contributors on how to avail of this functionality, and how to avoid common pitfalls while using it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add documentation for PR authors on how to use fixup commits" (#33042)

Issues.Title: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError with Interceptor and component interaction(Angular 8)
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report 

### Affected Package
"@angular/core": "8.2.5"
"@angular/common": "8.2.5"

### Description

I'm facing some common issue on Angular template, I have this general template for all my pages and inside of it I have a *ngIf with a spinner inside and another one with my router-outlet.
The interceptor controlls the behavior and visibility of the spinner, so with that comes the error, in a specific component I subscribe on a http method on a ngOnInit and the result of that is the error.
This error just happen if I call some method on lifecycle methods. I already tried some workarounds like envolve the setSpinnerState with setTimeout and tried to use other lifecycle hooks(AfterViewInit, AfterContentInit...).
Also a tried to use changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush on my LayoutComponent Notation and this on the component lifecycle: 
`ngOnChanges(){
    this.cdr.detectChanges();
  }`
With the code above the error disappears, but the spinner behavior stop to work.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xyulo9](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xyulo9)

## üî• Exception or Error
`ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'ngIf: true'. Current value: 'ngIf: false'.
    at viewDebugError (core.js:28792)
    at expressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError (core.js:28769)
    at checkBindingNoChanges (core.js:29757)
    at checkNoChangesNodeInline (core.js:44442)
    at checkNoChangesNode (core.js:44415)
    at debugCheckNoChangesNode (core.js:45376)
    at debugCheckDirectivesFn (core.js:45273)
    at Object.eval [as updateDirectives] (LayoutsComponent.html:10)
    at Object.debugUpdateDirectives [as updateDirectives] (core.js:45258)
    at checkNoChangesView (core.js:44248)`

## Your Environment
MacOS 10.14.6
Angular Cli 8.3.5
Typescript 3.4.3

**Anything else relevant?**
Browser: Chrome 77.0.3865.90
Visual Studio Code
My question on Stackoverflow :
[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58276430/expressionchangedafterithasbeencheckederror-on-angular-8-and-method-called-on-ng](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58276430/expressionchangedafterithasbeencheckederror-on-angular-8-and-method-called-on-ng)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError with Interceptor and component interaction(Angular 8)" (#33037)

Issues.Title: [Ivy] NgClass adding incorrect classes on subsequent CD runs
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/common or @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, it works correctly with VE ### Description I have encountered a weird issue with NgClass directive when testing Ivy update. I have a template like this: ```
``` "isDisabled" variable is defined in the component and always equals boolean false in this particular case(and i have verified this using devtools). On the initial page load without user interaction the result html is correct: a div with main-content class only. But when CD is triggered somewhere down the component tree via user interaction, which caused some DOM modifications in child components, main-content_disabled class gets added to the div (though the value of isDisabled property on the component is still false). I have debugged into this a little bit by putting breakpoint on attribute modifications for this element and have probably discovered a cause for this issue(please look at the attached screenshot with devtools): setClass method is being called with className="main-content_disabled" and value="false". String false and not a boolean false. This causes the wrong branch to be executed, adding class instead of removing it. The transformation from false to "false" happened up in the callstack in the applyStylingValue method here: ``` if (isStylingValueDefined(valueToApply)) { valueToApply = sanitizer ? sanitizer(prop, value, 2 /* SanitizeOnly */) : valueToApply; } ``` Sanitizer here transforms false into "false", which is probably not what should have happened. Please let me know, if i could provide any additional info for this case. ## üî• Exception or Error ![ngClassIssue1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25816676/66389930-2d10f200-e9d2-11e9-8569-605d70ec80c7.PNG) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: Injector in Dynamic Component Loader doesn't respect Interface
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No. I detected this bug in angular 7.2.15, but it is still present. ### Description The implementation of Injector used in Dynamic Component Loader doesn't respect de the new interface of Injector. This cause the imposibility of use flags in retrieving an instance from the injector. You can see the code referenced here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/view/refs.ts#L337 https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/di/injector.ts#L59-L60 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-yd2tpn ## üî• Exception or Error

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
In the AoT compiler guide (https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#supported-classes-and-functions) the following sentence can be found:

> The compiler can only create instances certain classes, supports only core decorators, and only supports calls to macros (functions or static methods) that return expressions.

The part _"**...can only create instances certain classes...**"_ is grammatically incorrect.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

> The compiler can only create instances **of** certain classes, supports only core decorators, and only supports calls to macros (functions or static methods) that return expressions.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

Issues.Title: BUG: IVY ViewContainerRef does not remove item with animation (Route)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
`@angular/core`
`@angular/common`
`@angular/animations`
`@angular/router`

Probably one of these

### Is this a regression?
I am not sure, but i think it was working without IVY, so it is possible that it is regression.

### Description

When you have route with animation (little complex animation) on component which is routet, after changing route, new component appear next to old component which is not removed and this will stack.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

> `clone https://github.com/kukjevov/ng-universal-demo.git`
> `cd ng-universal-demo`
> `git checkout ivy-error`
> `npm install`
> `npm start`
> open browser at `http://localhost:8888`
> click on garden link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link
> click on *Garden* link
> click on *Home* link

then you will see that `home-view` will be there multiple times (it is not removed after changing route)

## üî• Exception or Error

No exception just not removed component from view.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

**Versions:**
angular: 9.0.0-next.9
nodejs: 10.16.0
npm: 6.9.0
windows: 10.0.17763 Build 17763

Issues.Title: Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/platform-browser ### Is this a regression? This is kind of regression - please see description bellow. ### Description I am getting **Typescript error** after switching to *Ivy compiler*: ```bash [Step 4/5] src/app/app.component.html(1,26): Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'. ``` In Angular class there is a member property declared as `SafeHtml`: ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'app', template: `
` }) export class AppComponent { description: SafeHtml; constructor(private sanitizer: DomSanitizer) {} ngOnInit(): void { this.description = this.sanitizer.sanitize(SecurityContext.HTML, 'whatever comes from server'); } } ``` My issue is how to convert `SafeHtml` and `SafeUrl` to string, so that strict template check does not emits an error - I would like to avoid calling `.toString()` on the `description` - it should work out of the box - at least it is my expectation. Angular `SafeHtml` is declared as: ```typescript /** * Marker interface for a value that's safe to use as HTML. * * @publicApi */ export declare interface SafeHtml extends SafeValue { } ``` And `innerHtml` defined in _lib.dom.d.ts_: ```typescript interface InnerHTML { innerHTML: string; } ``` The `innerHtml` is type of `string`, whereas I have `SafeHtml`. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction How to reproduce: ```bash git clone https://github.com/felikf/angular-repro-safe-html.git npm i npm run build ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

Type 'SafeHtml' is not assignable to type 'string'
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 8.3.4
Node: 12.11.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

@angular-devkit/core               8.3.4
@angular-devkit/schematics         8.3.4
@angular/cdk                       8.2.0
@angular/cli                       8.3.4
@angular/flex-layout               8.0.0-beta.27
@angular/material                  8.2.0
@angular/material-moment-adapter   8.2.0
@ngtools/webpack                   8.3.6
@schematics/angular                8.3.4
@schematics/update                 0.803.4
rxjs                               6.5.3
typescript                         3.5.3
webpack                            4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** This happens during `npm run build`. Also asked here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58265539/angular-ivy-type-check-type-safehtml-is-not-assignable-to-type-string

Issues.Title: Add `Location.urlChanges` as Observable<{url, state}>
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/common




### Description

Currently, `Location` class exposes `onUrlChange` event listener. To get URL changes as `Observable`, we have to create own wrapper service. And this is a common use case; to reflect URL to title, meta data, or etc...

`Router.events` is like this but URL change event doesn't depend on Router. It should just wrap platform's location change.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add `Location.urlChanges` field.

```ts
class Location {
  readonly urlChanges: Observable<{url: string; state: unknown}>;
}
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered

Current workaround

```ts
const urlChanges$ = new Subject();
location.onUrlChange((url) => {
  urlChanges$.next(url);
});
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add `Location.urlChanges` as Observable<{url, state}>" (#33021)

# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No idea, first time use. ### Description I am create a library by angular cli, and want to reuse this library in other projects The dependency in constructor will throw a "ERROR ReferenceError: HttpClient is not defined" ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. create a new solution, then generate a library `ng new CrankAngularComponents --createApplication=false` `ng generate library crank-angular-components --prefix=crank` 2. modify the example code, add a Service in the component constructor add a HttpClient in the service constructor ( detail can be check in the demo) https://github.com/YouQingnzfintech/angular-custom-library-di-fail-demo https://github.com/YouQingnzfintech/angular-custom-library-di-fail-demo/blob/master/projects/crank-angular-components/src/lib/crank-angular-components.component.ts https://github.com/YouQingnzfintech/angular-custom-library-di-fail-demo/blob/master/projects/crank-angular-components/src/lib/crank-angular-components.service.ts ## üî• Exception or Error 


ERROR ReferenceError: HttpClient is not defined

    at CompileMetadataResolver._getInjectableTypeMetadata (compiler.js:20512)
    at CompileMetadataResolver.getProviderMetadata (compiler.js:20521)
    at compiler.js:20459
    at Array.forEach ()

Issues.Body:

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```
schematics

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
While the original purpose of schematics is to provide scaffolding for node.js projects, they can also be used to set up scaffolding for non-javascript projects that happen to use node based tools.  In this case, installing packages locally doesn't make sense, whereas installing tools globally can be extremely useful.  In particular, I'm working on some schematics to set up [antora](https://gitlab.com/antora/antora) projects and installing antora globally is pretty much a necessary feature.  Rather than including a customized copy of the node-package task I think it makes sense to enhance the built-in task.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Enhance the schematics node-package task with a global flag.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
I can package this with my schematics, but this seems like a generally useful feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extend the schematics node-package task to allow installing individual packages globally." (#15782)

# üöÄ Feature request
To include folder for modules in the project initial structure at ng new assistant, for lazy loading.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update

- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
When I create a new project, I generate a principal module (home, explore, etc...) with a routing module, components, pipes, etc...

### Describe alternatives you've considered
This recommendation only apply for SPA.

Issues.Title: make angular-automatic-lock-bot lock issues only on activity
Issues.Body:
Every time the "angular-automatic-lock-bot" locks an issue that I was involved with, I receive a notification. This might be considered useless/annoying since it does not add any new information concerning the original issue. 

I understand of course that locking an issue is important in order to prevent people from "out-of-scope-discussing" (and notifying others) on an old issue. Nevertheless, notifying people about that fact that they will not be receiving any more notifications is somewhat undermining the original purpose. 

**Proposal: The issue should be kept open and only be locked after someone comments on it and a notification was sent out anyway.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "make angular-automatic-lock-bot lock issues only on activity" (#15771)

Issues.Title: Angular Library - NullInjectorError: StaticInjectorError(AppModule)[NgClassImpl -> ElementRef]
Issues.Body: I'm building a component in a Angular Library: ``` ``` But when I embed this component on my application I got: > ERROR NullInjectorError: StaticInjectorError(AppModule)[NgClassImpl -> ElementRef]: StaticInjectorError(Platform: core)[NgClassImpl -> ElementRef]: NullInjectorError: No provider for ElementRef! It happens because the _ngClass_. If I build my component inside the application, it works fine. I saw in a issue herer that I need to put _preserveSymlinks_ in my **tsconfig.lib.json**: ``` "angularCompilerOptions": { "annotateForClosureCompiler": true, "skipTemplateCodegen": true, "strictMetadataEmit": true, "fullTemplateTypeCheck": true, "strictInjectionParameters": true, "enableResourceInlining": true, "preserveSymlinks": true } ``` But it doesn't work anyway. Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Library - NullInjectorError: StaticInjectorError(AppModule)[NgClassImpl -> ElementRef]" (#15773)

Issues.Title: Ivy CSS @import requires exact file names
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

Yes, works pre-Ivy

### Description

9.0.0-next.6 CSS/SCSS @import statements do not resolve file names unless they are exact.
For example, pre-Ivy I could import the file `_variables.scss` with `@import './variables';`. In Ivy it must be `./_variables.scss`.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Migrate a project from version 8 to 9.0.0-next.6 that has CSS imports that omit *.scss or _'s from the import statements.

## üî• Exception or Error
```
This migration uses the Angular compiler internally and therefore projects that no longer build
successfully after the update cannot run the migration. Please ensure there are no AOT compilation
errors and rerun the migration.. The following project failed: src/tsconfig.app.json
            
            Error: error TS100: Couldn't resolve resource ../../assets/scss/common/component.common
from /.../src/app/common/app-header.component.scss
Migration can be rerun with: "ng update @angular/core --from 8.0.0 --to 9.0.0 --migrate-only"
            Successfully migrated all found undecorated classes
            that use dependency injection.
```


## üåç Your Environment
No longer available. Bug created after the fact on request of @Splaktar 

**Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ivy CSS @import requires exact file names" (#15772)

Issues.Title: Issue with `fullTemplateTypeCheck` and `ng serve`
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I don't know. ### Description When having `fullTemplateTypeCheck` enabled in `tsconfig.json` and running `ng serve` everything runs fine initially. I might, for example, get nice error messages about my template type-check issues (with colors and everything :smiley:): ``` ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:38:66 - error TS2322: Type 'SearchResults | null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. 38 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ src/app/app.component.ts:23:16 23 templateUrl: './app.component.html', ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent. ``` Then on re-compiling (e.g. after editing a file and saving), I get the following error: ``` ERROR in ./src/main.ts at plugin.done.then ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\loader.js:41:31) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) ERROR in ./src/polyfills.ts Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/index.js): Error: [...]\angular\aio\src\polyfills.ts is missing from the TypeScript compilation. Please make sure it is in your tsconfig via the 'files' or 'include' property. at AngularCompilerPlugin.getCompiledFile ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\angular_compiler_plugin.js:918:23) at plugin.done.then ([...]\angular\aio\node_modules\@ngtools\webpack\src\loader.js:41:31) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) i ÔΩ¢wdmÔΩ£: Failed to compile. ``` I might then get some error template type-check errors, but not as nicely formatted (or colorful) as before: ``` ERROR in src/app/app.component.html(38,66): error TS2322: Type 'SearchResults | null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'SearchResults | undefined'. src/app/app.component.html(47,63): error TS2322: Type 'NavigationNode[]' is not assignable to type 'Option[]'. Type 'NavigationNode' is not assignable to type 'Option'. Types of property 'title' are incompatible. Type 'string | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'. Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'. src/app/app.component.html(47,87): error TS2322: Type 'NavigationNode' is not assignable to type 'Option'. src/app/custom-elements/api/api-list.component.html(24,8): error TS2322: Type 'ApiSection[] | null' is not assignable to type 'ApiSection[] | Iterable | undefined'. ... ``` After this first error, the app is not re-compiled when I make changes (I have to stop the process and run `ng serve` anew). (NOTE: The error seems only (or much more often) happen when there _are_ template type-check errors.) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction It started happening for me in PR angular/angular#32980. To reproduce, you could: 1. Check out the PR. 2. Reset to the commit before ``build(docs-infra): enable `fullTemplateTypeCheck` (and fix failures)`` (currently https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/32980/commits/3f228a626). 3. Add `fullTemplateTypeCheck: true` in `aio/tsconfig.json > angularCompilerOptions`. 4. Run `yarn --cwd=aio && yarn --cwd=aio start`. _(You should see some nice template type-check error messages.)_ 5. Open `aio/src/app/app.component.ts`, make a change and save it. _(You should see the error.)_ (NOTE: If that reproduction isn't helpful, I can try to create a minimal one with a new app.) ## üåç Your Environment (NOTE: I am on 9.0.0-next.8 now, but this happened with 9.0.0-next.6 as well.) 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-next.8
Node: 10.16.3
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: refactor(dialog): remove deprecated APIs for 9.0.0
Issues.Body:
Removes the APIs that were scheduled to be removed from the dialog package in v9.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* `MatDialogRef.afterOpen` has been replaced with `MatDialogRef.afterOpened`.
* `MatDialogRef.beforeClose` has been replaced with `MatDialogRef.beforeClosed`.
* `MatDialog.afterOpen` has been replaced with `MatDialog.afterOpened`.
* `matDialogAnimations.slideDialog` has been replaced with `matDialogAnimations.dialogContainer`.
* `_location` parameter in `MatDialogRef` constructor has been removed.

Issues.Title: perf(tooltip): avoid triggering change detection for all keydown events
Issues.Body: Currently we only care about keydown events on the Escape key, while the tooltip is open, however since we're binding the listener through `host` it'll change detection for all `keydown` events.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(tooltip): avoid triggering change detection for all keydown events" (#17331)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): disabled state not synced on data binding changes
Issues.Body:
Usually we only sync up the drop list ref with the directive right before dragging starts, however if the disabled state is set, it can propagate to the child directives and prevent the user from ever starting a search again. These changes make it so whenever the disable state is set it'll get sync immediately.

Also changes a misleading method name.

Fixes #17325.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): disabled state not synced on data binding changes" (#17330)

Issues.Title: Drag and Drop cdkDropListDisabled odd binding
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-bj2u4w (working example)
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-4pnl1v (broken example)

When  you the `cdkDropListDisabled ` limit it appears that the next operation isn't setting the disable back to enabled.

In these examples there is a limit on the todo where the todo list should be drag disabed when it has only 1 item and the done list should be drag disabled when the todo list has 6 or more in it. 

Reproduce:
Move all but 1 item from todo and notice that you cannot move the final item out of todo list.
Move 1 from done back to todo. This SHOULD allow you to move an item from todo back to done since the  limit for cdkDropListDisabled  has been removed.
Notice that you cannot move from todo until you move a 3rd into todo. It is fixed if you drop or even just enter the 3rd item into the todo list.

other way of breaking:
Move 6 items into todo and notice you cannot move a 7th item into todo
Move 1 from todo to done. This SHOULD allow you to move an item from done into todo.
Notice you cannot move from done into todo until you reduce the todo count to 4. It is fixed by dropping OR simply entering the done list from todo.
 
#### Expected Behavior

When the cdkDropListDisabled becomes false it should actually let me interact with the draggable list again.


#### Actual Behavior

cdkDropListDisabled is not re-enabling the list after the first operation that makes it false.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2
- Browser(s): Edge, Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag and Drop cdkDropListDisabled odd binding" (#17325)

How can i link one variable ( @ViewChild(CdkDropListGroup, null) group: CdkDropListGroup ) to the first CdkGroupList and other variable to the second CdkGroupList in the HTML? Issues.Title: Mat-Select with Ag-Grid on Edge
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://angular-vt3fhy.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on cell in Edge
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Select box is approximately the same width as the cell.


#### Actual Behavior

Select box is the width of the entire grid.

I believe the problem lies in this line of code:
`this._triggerRect = this.trigger.nativeElement.getBoundingClientRect();`
In Chrome, the trigger element is the cell, but in Edge, I believe it is the grid itself.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.9
- CDK/Material: 8.2.2
- Browser(s): Edge 44 (but not present in 42)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Select with Ag-Grid on Edge" (#17321)

Issues.Title: Talkback announces wrong state on radio button selection
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load https://material.angular.io/components/radio/examples on android chrome browser
2. Start Talkback
3. Select 'Autumn' option from the first example (talkback reads 'Selected')
4. Navigate to 'Summer' (talkback reads 'Summer radio button not selected')
5. Select 'Summer' (talkback reads 'Not selected')
6. Select 'Autumn' again (talkback reads 'Selected')
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
When selecting a **previous** radio button, talkback should announce the correct state, 'Selected'

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
When selected a **previous** radio button, talkback announces it's previous state

#### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Mobile Chrome, Android WebView
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Android
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Talkback announces wrong state on radio button selection" (#17319)

Issues.Title: build: changelog should not show changes to google-maps
Issues.Body:
We don't release the google-maps package and disabled the
package group in the changelog. Apparently there is a bug where
we do not detect commits as google-maps changes if the commit
format does not specify an explicit package, but rather just a scope.

We usually determine the package based on the scope by looking
for matching packages. This did not work for `google-maps` changes
such as 30de283
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: changelog should not show changes to google-maps" (#17313)

Issues.Title: MatPaginatedTabHeader has performance problems (forced synchronous layout).
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  open Chrome dev tools / Performance
2. start recording a profile and go to https://next.angular.io/guide/router
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

`MatPaginatedTabHeader` should not be the perf hot spot / bottleneck for AIO

#### Actual Behavior

The [_checkPaginationEnabled](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/8c9801398c9593cc29c292d65bd206463909a432/src/material/tabs/paginated-tab-header.ts#L462-L475) methods triggers a forced synchronous layout (by doing `const isEnabled = this._tabList.nativeElement.scrollWidth > this._elementRef.nativeElement.offsetWidth;`.

This forced synchronous layout accounts for **~38% of the entire JS processing time on the critical TTI path** (see attached recording). Similar bottlenecks were spotted on other profiled sites (ex. https://www.mustakbil.com/)

[Dev tools profile recording](https://github.com/angular/components/files/3698146/aio_mat_tab_forced_layout.json.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatPaginatedTabHeader has performance problems (forced synchronous layout). " (#17317)

Issues.Title: IE11 Datepicker wrong date
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-stuebn

Steps to reproduce:
1. open the stackblitz here with IE11 or replicate it on your computer.
2. Open the datepicker
3) it shoud show you the date of September 14, 2020 and September 21, 2020. But IE11 show something like February 9, 2021 and September 9 2021.

See the correct dates. This applies only to IE. Other browsers are unaffected.

#### Environment

- CDK/Material: 8.2.2
- Browser(s): IE11
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Fedora 30

Issues.Title: MatTable default filter not working with nested objects
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

quick example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-r6dfy7

Steps to reproduce:
1. try filtering for a weight
2. no match will be found
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I would expect, that even though weight is now an object, it get's correctly converted to a string and will be searched accordingly.

#### Actual Behavior

If we take a look at the default filter function in [MatDataSource](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/table/table-data-source.ts) we can see that the output is just [object object] and not the actual values.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.0
- CDK/Material: 8.1.3
- Browser(s): Chrome  77.0.3865.90
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Win 10 Version 10.0.18362 Build 18362
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTable default filter not working with nested objects" (#17315)

Issues.Title: Performance Improvement For Mat-Menu And Mat-Table Sort Header
Issues.Body:
I have created one common table component, within it i am using mat-menu to provide actions on row. i was optimizing the component during which i found some bugs. When we hover on matmenu it trigger changedetection in angular. same happening with table header hover as well. 

I think change detection is not neccessary on hover, as for huge table on mobile devices it creates lag.

In Below demo example once we open console we can check changedetection is triggered.

Demo URL : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-uyqypq
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Performance Improvement For Mat-Menu And Mat-Table Sort Header" (#17311)
